maml:description.maml:para: List availability reports.
Returns an array of the results of availability tests run in the specified time period.
The SLA test's ID.
Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
A timestamp for the end of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
A timestamp for the end of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
The SLA test's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
List performance reports.
Returns an array of the results of performance tests run in the specified time period.

Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
A timestamp for the end of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.

Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
List agent groups.
Returns an array of all agent group identifiers and their corresponding descriptions. You can use this to retrieve a human-readable equivalent of the `agentGroupId` numbers.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get a test configuration.
Lists all test configurations or returns an individual record by its `-SLATestID`.
The SLA test's ID.

List test configuration quotas.
Retrieves test quotas to find out how many test configurations are allowed and how many are in use.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create a new test configuration.
Create either a new availability test configuration or a new performance test configuration, if there is an available corresponding slot in the contract's quotas.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Delete a test configuration.

Removes a test configuration. Once you delete a test configuration, you can't retrieve it or any data that it has collected. Set the `-SLATestID` parameter to indicate which test configuration to delete. Deletion can't be undone.
The SLA test's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The SLA test's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Update a test configuration.
Changes an existing test configuration, such as changing the agent group or adding a performance target. Set the `-SLATestID` parameter to indicate which test configuration to update.
The SLA test's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
